channel.title: Bloomberg Markets

item.title: Ex-Goldman Banker Leads China’s Push to Revive Hong Kong Finance
item.description: The crowd was taken aback as China’s point person for financial matters in Hong Kong laid out plans to re-energize the city’s markets.
item.dc:creator: Kiuyan Wong

media:content.media:description: Qi Bin, executive vice president of China Investment Corp. (CIC), speaks at the Milken Institute Global Conference in Beverly Hills, California, U.S., on Monday, May 1, 2017. The conference is a unique setting that convenes individuals with the capital, power and influence to move the world forward meet face-to-face with those whose expertise and creativity are reinventing industry, philanthropy and media. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Stocks, Bonds Climb as Trade-Truce Rally Holds: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian equity futures were supported by gains on Wall Street in a sign the stock market rally has further to run. Treasuries advanced as traders priced in two Federal Reserve rate cuts this year.
item.dc:creator: Richard Henderson

item.title: Bridgit Mendler: We're Aiming to Build a Global Network
item.description: Bridgit Mendler, Northwood Co-Founder and CEO speaks with Romaine Bostick about their recent $30M funding round for creating infrastructure for the space era. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Burry Bets Against Nvidia, China Stocks in Run-Up to Trade War
item.description: Michael Burry’s Scion Asset Management liquidated almost its entire equity portfolio in the first quarter, while taking on fresh bearish wagers on Nvidia Corp. and China-related stocks before US President Donald Trump launched a trade war and roiled global markets.
item.dc:creator: Yiqin Shen

media:content.media:description: NEW YORK, NY - NOVEMBER 23: Michael Burry attends "The Big Short" New York screening Ziegfeld Theater on November 23, 2015 in New York City. (Photo by Astrid Stawiarz/Getty Images)

item.title: India’s Shapoorji Signs $3.4 Billion Record Private Credit Deal
item.description: Indian real estate and construction conglomerate Shapoorji Pallonji Group signed a $3.4 billion private credit deal, a person familiar with the matter said, marking the biggest of its kind in the country,
item.dc:creator: Saikat Das, Nic Querolo

media:content.media:description: An advertisement for the BKC 9 residential project under construction, developed by Shapoorji Pallonji Group, in Mumbai, India, on Wednesday, May 14, 2025. Indian real estate and construction conglomerate Shapoorji Pallonji Group is aiming to sign a $3.4 billion private credit deal in coming hours that would be the country’s biggest ever, people familiar with the matter said.

item.title: Chinese Disinflation Wave Is Set to Boost Emerging-Market Bonds
item.description: A wave of Chinese exports redirected toward emerging markets is likely to help crimp inflation across the developing world and bolster longer-maturity bonds, fund managers say.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Bosley, Mary Nicola

item.title: Rashaun Williams Launches $750M Sports Fund
item.description: Rashaun Williams, Harbinger Sports Partners Founder & CIO speaks with Romaine Bostick about starting a $750M fund with Mark Cuban in US pro sports. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Deputy Treasury Chief Says August Is Earliest for X-Date Worries
item.description: Deputy Treasury Secretary Michael Faulkender said that federal tax receipts have been coming in higher than a year ago, helping bolster confidence that August is the earliest point for concerns about staying within the federal debt limit.
item.dc:creator: Enda Curran, Kailey Leinz, Joe Mathieu

media:content.media:description: Michael Faulkender, deputy US treasury secretary, during a Bloomberg Television interview outside the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, April 11, 2025. Faulkendersaid US President Donald Trump is looking for China to pull back on its tariff retaliation and come to the table to work out a new trade deal.

item.title: Coinbase Hack Rocks the Company That Led Crypto Into Mainstream
item.description: On the long list of crypto companies that have been hacked, there are plenty of examples of financial losses that are much more painful than what Coinbase Global Inc. appears to be facing from the attack it disclosed on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Margi Murphy, Emily Nicolle

media:content.media:description: The Coinbase website on a smartphone.

item.title: Buffett’s Berkshire Sat Out Market Drop, Trimmed Bank Stocks
item.description: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc. made no major purchases during the market slump that preceded President Donald Trump’s trade war, instead whittling or selling off holdings in financial stocks during the first quarter.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Rajbhandari

media:content.media:description: Warren Buffett, chairman and chief executive officer of Berkshire Hathaway Inc., speaks at the Goldman Sachs 10,000 Small Businesses Summit in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Tuesday, Feb. 13, 2018. Goldman's 10,000 Small Businesses is an investment that brings economic opportunity and assists entrepreneurs to create jobs by providing better access to education, capital and business support services.

item.title: S&P 500 Rises as Fed-Cut Bets Sink Treasury Yields: Markets Wrap
item.description: Wall Street traders drove stocks higher as bond yields sank after the latest economic data spurred speculation the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates twice this year to prevent a recession.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers praised US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent for getting China to agree to a 90-day pause on tariffs. He calls it a good thing for the US economy. He spoke on Bloomberg Television’s Wall Street Week with David Westin.

item.title: S&P 500 Advances for Fourth Day as Value Stocks Draw Investors
item.description: US stocks notched a fourth-straight session of gains on Thursday, as advances in so-called value stocks offset a lackluster day for technology, retail and energy shares.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: A Meta store in Burlingame, California, US.

item.title: Markets Not Pricing In the Bad Data Ahead: Morgan Stanley's Zentner
item.description: Ellen Zentner, Morgan Stanley Wealth Management's chief economic strategist and global head of thematic macro investing, says the markets are not pricing in the bad inflation data that is ahead. She speaks on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Is the Age of American Exceptionalism Over?
item.description: Markets used to know what to do in a crisis: bet on Treasuries and the dollar. But lately the US has ceased being the unquestioned haven. If American exceptionalism is faltering, what will take its place? (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Brazil’s Real Weakens on Talk of New Spending to Boost Lula
item.description: The prospect of a government funded aid package to help boost the sagging popularity of Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva sent the currency reeling on fears any extra spending would widen the country’s fiscal deficit.
item.dc:creator: Martha Viotti Beck, Simone Iglesias, Leda Alvim

item.title: US Bonds Rally as Economic Data Backs Bets on Two 2025 Fed Cuts
item.description: Treasuries gained as a fresh spate of economic data offered signs of ebbing economic activity and dimming inflation, supporting bets that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates twice this year.
item.dc:creator: Liz Capo McCormick, Alice Gledhill

item.title: Greylock's Humes Sees Risks, Opportunities in Emerging Markets
item.description: Greylock Capital CEO and CIO Hans Humes discusses the outlook for emerging markets amid President Donald Trump's tariffs. He speaks with Romaine Bostick on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P 500 & Nasdaq 100 Close Higher | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Scarlet Fu, Emily Graffeo and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stock Returns From Now Will Be Modest: UBS's Lovell
item.description: UBS Financial Services Senior Strategist of US Equity Nadia Lovell gives her outlook on the markets in an interview with Scarlet Fu on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Thoma Bravo Sells Remaining $3.4 Billion Nasdaq Stake
item.description: Thoma Bravo sold its remaining stake in Nasdaq Inc. for proceeds of about $3.4 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: The Nasdaq MarketSite in New York, US, on Wednesday, April 9, 2025. Five days after President Donald Trump's America-versus-the-world trade war threw stock and bond markets around the world into disarray, he backpedaled and, in the process, pulled the financial system back from the brink.

item.title: Canada’s S&P/TSX Composite Index Closes at Record High
item.description: Canada’s stocks benchmark closed at a record on Thursday, a dramatic reversal for an index that entered a correction less than six weeks ago and seen as a major sentiment boost for investors.
item.dc:creator: Geoffrey Morgan, Curtis Heinzl

item.title: Smart Money Loses to Retail Crowd That Bet on Stock Rebound
item.description: President Donald Trump’s tariffs announcement on April 2 devastated financial assets, wiping out some $6 trillion in market value from US stocks in just two trading days. Wall Street’s “smart money” — hedge funds and other professional investors — dumped equities, and strategists urged clients to flee.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova

item.title: Ontario to Sell More Debt Abroad as Deficit, Spending Grow
item.description: Ontario plans to borrow C$59.8 billion ($42.7 billion) to fund a larger budget deficit and spending on highways and other infrastructure, and expects more of it will come from foreign currency bond sales.
item.dc:creator: Chunzi Xu

media:content.media:description: Peter Bethlenfalvy, Ontario's finance minister, speaks during a media event at a Honda of Canada Manufacturing plant in Alliston, Ontario, Canada, on Thursday, April 25, 2024. Honda Motor Co. will spend C$15 billion ($11 billion) to build out its electric-vehicle supply chain in Canada, with billions of dollars of financial aid from government, as the Japanese automaker seeks to tap long-term demand in the region.

item.title: Trade War Brings Ontario Budget Deficit to Near Pandemic Levels
item.description: Ontario’s budget shortfall is expected to reach its highest level since the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic as the effects of the trade war hurt economic growth.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Hughes

media:content.media:description: Doug Ford, Ontario's premier, arrives at the First Minister's Meeting at the Canadian War Museum in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, on Friday, March 21, 2025. Mark Carney, Canada's prime minister, is set to call a national election within days, seeking his own mandate from voters at a time when the country's businesses have been shaken by a trade war with the US.

item.title: Goldman Sees AI Investment Boosting Structured Finance
item.description: Companies are seeking vast amounts of capital for a wide range of artificial intelligence-linked projects, including building data centers and fiber optic networks, creating demand for funding in structured finance markets.
item.dc:creator: Scott Carpenter

item.title: AXA Investment Managers' Bigos on Market Sentiment
item.description: AXA Investment Managers CIO for Asia Ex-Japan Core Investments Ecaterina Bigos discusses market sentiment following a pause in tariffs on China. She speaks with Haslinda Amin on Bloomberg TV. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Sabesp Eyes Bond Market in Push for Investment-Grade Rating, CFO Says
item.description: Latin America’s largest utility, Cia. de Saneamento Básico do Estado de São Paulo, is preparing to return to the bond market for the first time in more than 20 years as it seeks an investment-grade credit rating, according to its finance chief.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Gamarski

media:content.media:description: A facility operated by Sabesp, a state-owned water and sewage treatment company, in Sao Paulo, Brazil, on Tuesday, Dec. 12, 2023. Latin America's largest water utility got the green light to be privatized next year, in a win for right-wing Sao Paulo Governor Tarcisio de Freitas, who has pledged to improve public services. Photographer: Victor Moriyama/Bloomberg

item.title: Meta to Delay Rollout of AI Model ‘Behemoth’: WSJ
item.description: Meta is delaying the rollout of a flagship AI model, prompting internal concerns about the direction of its multibillion-dollar AI investments, people familiar with the matter said. Mandeep Singh has more on “Bloomberg The Close.”

item.title: UBS US Economist Abigail Watt's Market Outlook
item.description: UBS US Economist Abigail Watt gives her take on the markets following the stock recovery after "liberation day." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Nia Impact Capital CEO's Market Outlook
item.description: Nia Impact Capital Founder and CEO Kristin Hull gives her take on the markets following the stock recovery after "liberation day." She speaks with Yvonne Man on Bloomberg TV. (Source: Bloomberg)
